title: 'Watermelondrea' responds to Raven-Symonè's name comments
text:
ThisIsACommentary/Youtube YouTube star Tre Melvin responded to Raven-Symone's comments that she would never hire someone with the name Watermelondrea. YouTube star Tre Melvin fired back at Raven-Symonè’s controversial statement that she would never hire someone with a “ghetto” name — by responding with his alter ego, Watermelondrea.
The comedian recorded his comments and posted the clip after “The View” co-host said on the show she would never consider someone with the name Watermelondrea for a job.
Although Melvin only uses the pseudonym for his YouTube channel — which boasts nearly three million subscribers — Melvin took the matter to heart.
Charles Sykes/Charles Sykes/Invision/AP "The View" host, Raven Symone, stirred up contorversy when she said she would never hire someone with a "ghetto" name. “You have the audacity to sit there on ‘The View’ in front of millions of people...and say you will decline a career opportunity because their name isn’t proper enough for their liking?” Melvin said.
“People don’t exactly have control of the names they are given at birth.”

Raven-Symonè later apologized for her comments saying despite the joke she never personally "discriminated against a name" and admited her comment was in "poor taste."
Even though the personality lashed out in the video — titled “Dear Raven-Symonè, Sincerely Watermelondrea” — Melvin urged his followers to not attack the host on social media.
